description:
'''Michael Trent Reznor''' (born May 17, 1965) is an American singer, songwriter, musician, and composer. He came to prominence as the founder, lead singer, multi-instrumentalist, and primary songwriter of the [[industrial rock]] band [[Nine Inch Nails]]. The band's line-up has constantly changed, with Reznor being its only official member from its creation in 1988 until 2016, when he added English musician and frequent collaborator [[Atticus Ross]] as its second permanent member.

Reznor began his career in 1982 as a member of [[synth-pop]] bands such as [[The Innocent (band)|The Innocent]], [[Slam Bamboo]], and [[Exotic Birds]]. The first Nine Inch Nails album, ''[[Pretty Hate Machine]]'' (1989), was a moderate success but largely remained popular with underground audiences; the next two albums, ''[[The Downward Spiral]]'' (1994) and ''[[The Fragile]]'' (1999), brought the band widespread critical acclaim. There have since been [[Nine Inch Nails discography|eight more Nine Inch Nails albums and six EPs]]. Reznor has also contributed to the work of artists such as his protégé [[Marilyn Manson (singer)|Marilyn Manson]], rapper [[Saul Williams]], and pop singer [[Halsey (singer)|Halsey]]. Alongside his wife [[Mariqueen Maandig]] and long-time collaborators [[Atticus Ross]] and [[Rob Sheridan]], he formed the [[Post-industrial music|post-industrial]] group [[How to Destroy Angels (band)|How to Destroy Angels]] in 2009.

Since 2010, Reznor and Ross have worked on numerous film and television scores, most notably for movies directed by [[David Fincher]] and [[Luca Guadagnino]]. These include Fincher's ''[[The Social Network]]'' (2010), ''[[The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011 film)|The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo]]'' (2011), and ''[[Gone Girl (film)|Gone Girl]]'' (2014), as well as Guadagnino's ''[[Bones and All (soundtrack)|Bones and All]]'' (2022), ''[[Challengers (soundtrack)|Challengers]]'' (2024), and ''[[Queer (film)#Music|Queer]]'' (2024). Reznor and Ross won the [[Academy Award for Best Original Score]] for ''The Social Network'' and ''[[Soul (2020 film)|Soul]]'' (2020) and the [[Grammy Award for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media]] for ''The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo'' and ''Soul'', sharing both awards for ''Soul'' with co-composer [[Jon Batiste]]. Reznor and Ross won the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Music Composition for a Limited Series, Movie, or Special|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Music Composition for a Limited Series]] for ''[[Watchmen (TV series)|Watchmen]]'' (2019). The pair also scored [[Ken Burns|Ken Burns's]] 10-part documentary ''[[The_Vietnam_War_(TV_series)|The Vietnam War]]'' (2017).
